member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.CellularDtmfMode
member.summary: Indicates the type of dual tone multi-frequency (DTMF) used by a cellular phone.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.CellularDtmfMode.Burst
member.summary: Tones are sent in a burst fashion.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.CellularDtmfMode.Continuous
member.summary: Tones are sent in a continuous fashion, meaning the tone should only stop when the button is released.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneAudioRoutingEndpoint
member.summary: The available audio endpoints you can use for dialing a phone call.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneAudioRoutingEndpoint.Bluetooth
member.summary: A Bluetooth connection.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneAudioRoutingEndpoint.Default
member.summary: The default audio endpoint for the phone.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneAudioRoutingEndpoint.Speakerphone
member.summary: A speaker phone.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallBlocking
member.summary: Controls the blocking of phone numbers as they are received.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallBlocking.BlockPrivateNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the PhoneCallBlocking instance should block private numbers.
member.returns: **True** if the PhoneCallBlocking instance should block private numbers, **false** otherwise.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallBlocking.BlockUnknownNumbers
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the PhoneCallBlocking instance should block unknown numbers.
member.returns: **True** if the PhoneCallBlocking instance should block unknown numbers, **false** otherwise.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallBlocking.SetCallBlockingListAsync(Windows.Foundation.Collections.IIterable{System.String})
member.summary: Sets the list of numbers that should be blocked.
member.param: A list of numbers that should be blocked.
member.returns: **True** if the operation was successful, otherwise **false**.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallManager
member.summary: Provides the ability to query the call status and launch phone calls.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallManager.IsCallActive
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates whether an active call is in progress on the device.
member.returns: True if an active call is in progress on the device; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallManager.IsCallIncoming
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if a call is incoming on the device.
member.returns: True if a call is incoming on the device; otherwise false.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallManager.CallStateChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the basic call state of the device changes.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallManager.RequestStoreAsync
member.summary: Retrieves a PhoneCallStore.
member.returns: A PhoneCallStore object that contains information about the phone lines available on the device.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallManager.ShowPhoneCallSettingsUI
member.summary: Launches the call settings UI.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallManager.ShowPhoneCallUI(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Launches the built-in phone call UI with the specified phone number and display name.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallMedia
member.summary: The types of media available in a phone call.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallMedia.Audio
member.summary: The phone call supports audio only.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallMedia.AudioAndRealTimeText
member.summary: The phone call supports audio and realtime text.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallMedia.AudioAndVideo
member.summary: The phone call supports audio and video.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallStore
member.summary: Represents a collection of information about the phone lines available on a device.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallStore.GetDefaultLineAsync
member.summary: Gets the line ID for the current default phone line.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation that returns the line ID upon successful completion.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallStore.IsEmergencyPhoneNumberAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Checks to see if a phone number connects to a known emergency services provider.
member.param: The phone number to check to see if it is a known emergency number.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation that returns a boolean on successful completion . True indicates that the phone number connects to a known emergency services provider.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallStore.RequestLineWatcher
member.summary: Retrieves an instance of the PhoneLineWatcher class for the device.
member.returns: An instance of the PhoneLineWatcher class for the device.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallVideoCapabilities
member.summary: Provides access to the video call capabilities for a PhoneLine instance.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallVideoCapabilities.IsVideoCallingCapable
member.summary: Gets whether this PhoneLine instance supports video calls.
member.returns: **True** if the PhoneLine instance supports video calls, **false** if it does not.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallVideoCapabilitiesManager
member.summary: Enables an application to get the PhoneCallVideoCapabilities for a PhoneLine instance.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneCallVideoCapabilitiesManager.GetCapabilitiesAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Asynchronously gets the video capabilities for a PhoneLine instance.
member.returns: The PhoneCallVideoCapabilities for the PhoneLine instance queried.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions
member.summary: Represents options for dialing a call.

member.summary: Creates a new instance of the class

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions.AudioEndpoint
member.summary: Gets or sets the audio endpoint requested for a dial.
member.returns: The audio endpoint requested for a dial.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions.Contact
member.summary: Gets or sets the address book contact associated with a dial request.
member.returns: The address book contact associated with a dial request.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions.ContactPhone
member.summary: Gets or sets the phone number property of the address book contact that is associated with the dial request.
member.returns: The phone number property of the address book contact associated with the dial request.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the party being dialed. This value is displayed if the number being dialed does not have a party name with a matching number in the user's address book.
member.returns: The name of the party being dialed.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions.Media
member.summary: Gets or Sets the type or types of media requested for a dial.
member.returns: The type or types of media requested for a dial.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions.Number
member.summary: Gets or sets the phone number to dial.
member.returns: The phone number to dial.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine
member.summary: Represents a phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.CanDial
member.summary: Gets a boolean value which indicates if the phone line can be used to place outgoing calls.
member.returns: True if the phone line can place outgoing calls; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.CellularDetails
member.summary: Gets details for the cellular component specific components for the PhoneLine instance. This property is NULL for VoIP phone lines.
member.returns: Details for the PhoneLine instance.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.DisplayColor
member.summary: Gets the preferred display color of the phone line.
member.returns: The preferred display color of the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets the user assigned friendly name for the phone line.
member.returns: The user assigned friendly name for the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.Id
member.summary: Gets the ID of the phone line. The ID is persistent across devices and reboots.
member.returns: The ID of the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.LineConfiguration
member.summary: Gets extra configuration information about this PhoneLine instance.
member.returns: The extra information for this phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.NetworkName
member.summary: Gets the name of the current network that is being used by the phone line.
member.returns: The name of the current network that is being used by the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.NetworkState
member.summary: Gets the current network status of the phone line.
member.returns: The current network status of the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.SupportsTile
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates if the phone line supports being pinned as a live tile.
member.returns: True if the phone line supports being pinned as a live tile; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.Transport
member.summary: Gets the transport for the phone line.
member.returns: The transport for the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.TransportDeviceId
member.summary: Device ID for the PhoneLineTransportDevice associated with this PhoneLine. Null if there is no transport device.
member.returns: String representing the Device ID.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.VideoCallingCapabilities
member.summary: Gets whether video calling is supported over this phone line.
member.returns: **True** if video calling is supported, **false** if it is not.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.Voicemail
member.summary: Gets the voice mail data associated with the PhoneLine instance.
member.returns: The voice mail data.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.LineChanged
member.summary: Occurs when and properties for the associated PhoneLine instance change. This can occur when meta data changes like the voice mail count, the network state, or the cellular details.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.Dial(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Place a phone call on the phone line. The caller must be in the foreground.
member.param: The display name of the party receiving the phone call. This parameter is optional.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.DialWithOptions(Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneDialOptions)
member.summary: Place a phone call on the phone line, allowing the caller to specify additional dial options. The caller must be in the foreground.
member.param: The additional dial options for the phone call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.EnableTextReply(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Informs the platform that text reply functionality is supported for this line.
member.param: True to enable text reply functionality, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.FromIdAsync(System.Guid)
member.summary: This static method asynchronously retrieves a PhoneLine object that represents a specific phone line on the device based on the line ID.
member.param: The line ID of the phone line to retrieve.
member.returns: An asynchronous operation that returns a PhoneLine object that represents a specific phone line on the device based on the line ID.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLine.IsImmediateDialNumberAsync(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a number should be dialed immediately from the dialer without requiring the user to press the call button.
member.param: The phone number to check for immediate dialing.
member.returns: An asynchronous boolean response. True indicates that the number should be dialed immediately.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineCellularDetails
member.summary: Provides detailed interaction with the cellular components of a phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineCellularDetails.IsModemOn
member.summary: Indicates if the modem for this phone line is on.
member.returns: True if the modem is on; otherwise false.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineCellularDetails.RegistrationRejectCode
member.summary: Gets the registration reject code for the phone line.
member.returns: The registration reject code for the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineCellularDetails.SimSlotIndex
member.summary: Get the slot index of the SIM card associated with a cellular phone line.
member.returns: The slot index of the SIM card associated with a cellular phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineCellularDetails.SimState
member.summary: Gets the state of the SIM card associated with a cellular phone line.
member.returns: The state of the SIM card associated with a cellular phone line.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineCellularDetails.GetNetworkOperatorDisplayText(Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineNetworkOperatorDisplayTextLocation)
member.summary: Retrieves the appropriate connection string to display to the user.
member.param: The location where the text string is needed. This affects the format of the returned string.
member.returns: The text string to display in the given location.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineConfiguration
member.summary: A collection of properties providing information about a phone line.

member.summary: Gets the extended properties for this phone line.
member.returns: A map of key-value pairs containing the extended properties of the phone line.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineConfiguration.IsVideoCallingEnabled
member.summary: Gets whether video calls are enabled over this phone line.
member.returns: **True** if video calls are supported, otherwise **false**.

member.summary: The possible locations for displaying network operator information to the user.

member.summary: The default value.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineNetworkOperatorDisplayTextLocation.Dialer
member.summary: The dialer UI.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineNetworkOperatorDisplayTextLocation.InCallUI
member.summary: The UI when the user as actively in a call.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineNetworkOperatorDisplayTextLocation.Tile
member.summary: The phone tile.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransport
member.summary: The transport used by a particular phone line.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransport.Bluetooth
member.summary: The phone line uses a bluetooth transport.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransport.Cellular
member.summary: The phone line uses a cellular transport.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransport.VoipApp
member.summary: The phone line uses a voice over IP transport.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice
member.summary: Represents the hardware device associated with a PhoneLine. Currently only supported for use with bluetooth devices.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.DeviceId
member.summary: Gets the DeviceID of the hardware device associated with the PhoneLineTransportDevice.
member.returns: A string representing the DeviceID.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.Transport
member.summary: Gets the PhoneLineTransport for the PhoneLineTransportDevice.
member.returns: The PhoneLineTransport.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.Connect
member.summary: Attempts to establish a connection with the device.
member.returns: The connection status once the operation completes. True if connected, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.ConnectAsync
member.summary: Attempts to asynchronously establish a connection with the device.
member.returns: An IAsyncOperation that represents the connection status once the operation completes. Contains true if connected, and false otherwise.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.FromId(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the PhoneLineTransportDevice from the given DeviceId.
member.returns: The PhoneLineTransportDevice or null if DeviceId does not correspond to existing device.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.GetDeviceSelector
member.summary: Gets an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string that the app can pass to DeviceInformation.FindAllAsync in order to find PhoneLineTransportDevices.
member.returns: String formatted as an AQS query.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.GetDeviceSelector(Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransport)
member.summary: Gets an Advanced Query Syntax (AQS) string that the app can pass to DeviceInformation.FindAllAsync in order to find PhoneLineTransportDevices of the given type.
member.param: A PhoneLineTransport specifying the desired type of PhoneLineTransportDevice.
member.returns: String formatted as an AQS query.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.IsRegistered
member.summary: Returns the registration status of the app for the active user.
member.returns: True if registered, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.RegisterApp
member.summary: Registers the app with Windows for the associated PhoneLineTransportDevice.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.RegisterAppForUser(Windows.System.User)
member.summary: Registers the app with Windows for the associated PhoneLineTransportDevice.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.RequestAccessAsync
member.summary: Used to request explicit access to the PhoneLineTransportDevice.
member.returns: After the asynchronous operation completes, returns a DeviceAccessStatus enumeration value.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.UnregisterApp
member.summary: Unregisters the app with Windows for the associated PhoneLineTransportDevice.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineTransportDevice.UnregisterAppForUser(Windows.System.User)
member.summary: Unregisters the app with Windows for the associated PhoneLineTransportDevice.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher
member.summary: Represents a class that monitors for new/removed/updated phone lines on the device and notifies listeners about any changes.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.Status
member.summary: Get the current status of the PhoneLineWatcher instance.
member.returns: The current status of the PhoneLineWatcher.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.EnumerationCompleted
member.summary: Occurs when the PhoneLineWatcher instance completes an enumeration of all the phone lines on the device.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.LineAdded
member.summary: Occurs when the PhoneLineWatcher instance detects a new phone line on the device.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.LineRemoved
member.summary: Occurs when the PhoneLineWatcher instance detects that a phone line has been removed from the device.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.LineUpdated
member.summary: Occurs when the PhoneLineWatcher instance detects that a phone line has been updated on the device.

member.name: E:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.Stopped
member.summary: Occurs when the PhoneLineWatcher instance stops monitoring the device for changes to the phone lines.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.Start
member.summary: Starts listening for changes to the phone lines on the device.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcher.Stop
member.summary: Stops listening for changes to the phone lines on the device.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcherEventArgs
member.summary: Represents a class that contains the information about which phone line was added, removed, or updated.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcherEventArgs.LineId
member.summary: Gets the ID of the phone line that triggered the LineAdded, LineRemoved, or LineUpdated event.
member.returns: The ID of the phone line that triggered the LineAdded, LineRemoved, or LineUpdated event.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcherStatus
member.summary: The current status of the PhoneLineWatcher.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcherStatus.Created
member.summary: The phone line watcher class is created.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcherStatus.EnumerationCompleted
member.summary: The phone line watcher class just completed an enumeration of the phone lines on the device.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcherStatus.Started
member.summary: The phone line watcher class is started.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneLineWatcherStatus.Stopped
member.summary: The phone line watcher class is stopped.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState
member.summary: Describes the network registration status of a phone line.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.Denied
member.summary: Could not register the phone line with any available network.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.Deregistered
member.summary: The phone line has been de-registered.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.Home
member.summary: The phone line is registered and is on the carrier's home network.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.NoSignal
member.summary: Could not detect a signal on the phone line, or the phone line is limited to emergency calls only.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.RoamingDomestic
member.summary: The phone line is registered and is roaming domestically on another carrier's network.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.RoamingInternational
member.summary: The phone line is registered and is roaming internationally on another carrier's network.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.Searching
member.summary: Searching for a network for the phone line.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneNetworkState.Unknown
member.summary: The registration status of the phone line is unknown.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState
member.summary: The current state of the SIM card for a cellular phone line.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.Disabled
member.summary: The SIM card is disabled.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.Invalid
member.summary: The SIM card is not valid.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.NotInserted
member.summary: There is no SIM card inserted into the phone.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.PinLocked
member.summary: The SIM card is locked and requires a PIN code to unlock.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.PinNotRequired
member.summary: The SIM card does not require a PIN code.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.PinUnlocked
member.summary: The SIM card is unlocked, but requires a PIN code to unlock again if it becomes locked.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.PukLocked
member.summary: The SIM card is locked due to too many incorrect PIN entries, and requires a Personal Unlocking Key (PUK) to unlock.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneSimState.Unknown
member.summary: The SIM card state is unknown.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemail
member.summary: Represents the voice mail data associated with a PhoneLine instance.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemail.MessageCount
member.summary: Get the current count of voice mail messages associated with the PhoneLine instance. A value of -1 indicates an "indeterminate" number of messages.
member.returns: The current count of voice mail messages.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemail.Number
member.summary: Gets the access number for the voice mail associated with the PhoneLine instance. The phone user can dial the access number to access the voice mail account.
member.returns: The access number.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemail.Type
member.summary: Get the type of the voice mail associated with the PhoneLine instance.
member.returns: The type of the voice mail account.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemail.DialVoicemailAsync
member.summary: Dials a call to the voice mail access number.
member.returns: An asynchronous dial operation.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemailType
member.summary: The type of voice mail associated with a PhoneLine instance.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemailType.None
member.summary: The phone line has no voice mail.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemailType.Traditional
member.summary: The phone line has traditional voice mail.

member.name: F:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.PhoneVoicemailType.Visual
member.summary: The phone line has visual voice mail.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin
member.summary: A collection of information about the origin of a phone call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new PhoneCallOrigin object.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin.Category
member.summary: Gets or sets the category for the caller.
member.returns: The caller's category. A couple of examples include "house agent" or "financial service."

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin.CategoryDescription
member.summary: Gets or sets the description of the caller's Category.
member.returns: The description of the caller's specific Category.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin.DisplayName
member.summary: Gets or sets the display name for the PhoneCallOriginManager object.
member.returns: The display name for the call origin manager.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin.DisplayPicture
member.summary: Gets or sets the display picture for the PhoneCallOriginManager object.
member.returns: The display picture for the caller's origin. This picture is displayed on the incoming call UI.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin.Location
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the caller.
member.returns: The caller's location.

member.name: T:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOriginManager
member.summary: Controls which application is responsible for determining the origin of incoming calls and sets the PhoneCallOrigin information.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOriginManager.IsCurrentAppActiveCallOriginApp
member.summary: Checks to see if the current application is set as the default call origin application.
member.returns: **True** if the current application is the default call origin application, otherwise **false**.

member.name: P:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOriginManager.IsSupported
member.summary: Returns true if PhoneCallOriginManager APIs are supported and false if they are not supported.
member.returns: The bool representing whether PhoneCallOriginManager APIs are supported or not.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOriginManager.RequestSetAsActiveCallOriginAppAsync
member.summary: Calls a dialog to set the current app as the default phone origin app.
member.returns: Indicates whether the app was set as the default phone origin application.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOriginManager.SetCallOrigin(System.Guid,Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the call origin when a phone call comes in.
member.param: The unique identifier for this phone call. This is retrieved from the *targetId* of the PhoneCallOriginDataRequestTriggerDetails
The call information for the incoming call.

member.name: M:Windows.ApplicationModel.Calls.Provider.PhoneCallOriginManager.ShowPhoneCallOriginSettingsUI
member.summary: Opens the interface that enables the user to select the call origin application.
